title.value: Automatic Head and Neck Tumor segmentation and outcome prediction relying on FDG-PET/CT images: Findings from the second edition of the HECKTOR challenge
title.justification: The title is clearly stated at the beginning of the paper, and it summarizes the main focus of the research, which is tumor segmentation and outcome prediction using FDG-PET/CT images.
title.quote: Automatic Head and Neck Tumor segmentation and outcome prediction relying on FDG-PET/CT images: Findings from the second edition of the HECKTOR challenge

extractions.description: This paper discusses the findings from the second edition of the HECKTOR challenge, which focused on developing and comparing image analysis methods for the automatic segmentation of head and neck tumors and outcome prediction using FDG-PET/CT images.

type.justification: The paper presents empirical findings from the second edition of the HECKTOR challenge, where various methods were developed, compared, and evaluated based on their performance.
type.quote: The goal of the HEad and neCK TumOR segmentation and outcome prediction (HECKTOR) challenge was to develop and compare modern image analysis methods to best extract and leverage this information automatically.

name.justification: The research primarily deals with analyzing medical images for better cancer detection and prediction, which falls under the field of medical imaging.
name.quote: Medical imaging challenges...have enabled a fair comparison of algorithms developed by various research teams across the world on large curated datasets.

name.justification: The paper focuses on segmenting head and neck tumors from medical images, which is a type of image segmentation.
name.quote: The goal of the HEad and neCK TumOR segmentation and outcome prediction (HECKTOR) challenge was to develop and compare...for cancerous lesion delineation and characterization.

name.justification: The paper involves radiomics, which is the extraction of large amounts of features from image data, and is mentioned as a crucial part of the research for outcome prediction.
name.quote: This methodological approach is today termed radiomics...exploited after image pre-processing and before the characterization of the detected and delineated tumor volume.

name.justification: U-Net is a commonly used model in medical image segmentation, and it is referenced multiple times in the paper as being successful for head and neck cancer segmentation.
name.quote: U-Net (Ronneberger et al., 2015) and its 3D variants are designed as fully-convolutional encoder–decoder networks with skip connections to leverage contextual information and precise localization.

is_contributed.justification: The paper references the U-Net model as a well-known architecture that participants used, but not as a model introduced by this paper.
is_contributed.quote: One of the most interesting findings was best PFS predictions were reached by relying on DL approaches (with or without explicit tumor segmentation).

is_executed.justification: The U-Net model and its variants are reported to have been executed by several participants in the challenge.
is_executed.quote: On the one hand, for the detection and/or segmentation, most of the algorithms proposed in the literature and in the context of medical image challenges are now based on DL, especially the U-Net (Ronneberger et al., 2015) architecture.

is_compared.justification: U-Net was one of the models used by challenge participants and its performance was compared with other submitted algorithms.
is_compared.quote: A total of 181 submissions evaluated successfully for the first task. A total of 41 teams participated... U-Net and its variants were common models used.

referenced_paper_title.value: U-net: Convolutional networks for biomedical image segmentation
referenced_paper_title.justification: To provide appropriate credit, the original paper introducing the U-Net is referenced in this context.
referenced_paper_title.quote: U-Net (Ronneberger et al., 2015) and its 3D variants

name.justification: The dataset used for the HECKTOR challenge is explicitly mentioned as being central to the research findings.
name.quote: The scope of the challenge was substantially expanded compared to the first edition, by providing a larger population... participants were given access to a training set of 224 cases from 5 different centers.

referenced_paper_title.value: Overview of the HECKTOR challenge at MICCAI 2020: automatic head and neck tumor segmentation in PET/CT
referenced_paper_title.justification: This title is referenced in relation to the dataset and its usage, providing historical context for the current research.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Overview of the HECKTOR challenge at MICCAI 2020: automatic head and neck tumor segmentation in PET/CT

name.justification: nnU-Net is mentioned as a popular framework adopted by participants for segmentation tasks in the challenge.
name.quote: nnU-Net has recently become a popular method for various medical image segmentation tasks.

referenced_paper_title.value: nnU-Net: a self-configuring method for deep learning-based biomedical image segmentation
referenced_paper_title.justification: The original paper describing the nnU-Net is appropriately referenced in relation to its use in the challenge.
referenced_paper_title.quote: nnU-Net (’’no new net’’) (Isensee et al., 2021) has recently become a popular method.
